ChatGPT said:

Your ProfilePage.jsx looks well-structured — it already uses modular components, a tab-based UI with @headlessui/react, and a centralized DB service.
However, I see a few areas where we can make it more efficient, scalable, and user-friendly without changing its intended functionality.

Suggested Improvements

1. Separate Tab Config from JSX

Instead of hardcoding both profilePageTabs and the <TabPanels> order manually, store them in a single config array.
That way, adding/removing a tab is just one change.

jsx
const profileTabs = [
  { label: "Overview", component: ProfileOverview },
  { label: "Links", component: ProfileLinks },
  { label: "Timetable", component: ProfileTimetable, extraProps: { key: "userId" } },
  { label: "Skills", component: ProfileSkills },
  { label: "Messaging", component: ProfileMessaging, extraProps: { key: "userId" } },
  { label: "Preferences", component: ProfilePreferences },
];

Then render them like:

jsx
<TabList className="profilepage-tab-list">
  {profileTabs.map((tab) => (
    <Tab
      key={tab.label}
      className={({ selected }) =>
        `profilepage-tab ${selected ? "profilepage-tab-selected" : ""}`
      }
    >
      {tab.label}
    </Tab>
  ))}
</TabList>

<TabPanels className="profilepage-tab-panels">
  {profileTabs.map(({ component: Component, extraProps }) => (
    <TabPanel key={Component.name}>
      <Component
        form={form}
        onChange={handleFormChange}
        {...(extraProps?.key === "userId" && { userId: user?.uid })}
      />
    </TabPanel>
  ))}
</TabPanels>

✅ Benefit: No risk of mismatched tab labels and panels.

2. Optimized Profile Fetch

Right now, getUserProfile runs every time the auth state changes, even if we already have it in state.
You could:

  • Cache the profile in localStorage to speed up reloads.

  • Only fetch from Firestore if the cache is missing or outdated.

Example:

jsx
useEffect(() => {
  const unsubscribe = onAuthStateChanged(getAuth(), async (currentUser) => {
    if (!currentUser) return navigate("/auth");

    setUser(currentUser);

    const cachedProfile = localStorage.getItem("userProfile");
    if (cachedProfile) {
      setForm((prev) => ({ ...prev, ...JSON.parse(cachedProfile) }));
      setDataLoaded(true);
      setLoading(false);
    }

    try {
      let profile = await getUserProfile(currentUser.uid);
      if (!profile) {
        profile = await createUserProfile(currentUser, {
          ...initialProfilePageForm,
          xp: 50,
        });
      }
      setForm((prev) => ({ ...prev, ...profile }));
      localStorage.setItem("userProfile", JSON.stringify(profile));
    } catch (err) {
      setError("Unable to load profile data.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
      setDataLoaded(true);
    }
  });

  return () => unsubscribe();
}, [navigate]);

3. Better Loading UX

Right now, you show "⏳ Loading profile..." in two places.
Instead, use a full-page spinner while loading the profile the first time:

jsx
if (loading && !dataLoaded) {
  return (
    <div className="profilepage-loading-screen">
      <div className="spinner"></div>
      <p>Loading your profile...</p>
    </div>
  );
}

And in CSS:

css
.profilepage-loading-screen {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  min-height: 70vh;
  font-size: 1.2rem;
}

.spinner {
  border: 4px solid #ddd;
  border-top: 4px solid var(--color-primary);
  border-radius: 50%;
  width: 40px;
  height: 40px;
  animation: spin 0.8s linear infinite;
}

@keyframes spin {
  100% { transform: rotate(360deg); }
}

4. Error Handling

Instead of a plain "❌ Unable to load profile data", you could let the user retry without refreshing the page:

jsx
{error && (
  <div className="profilepage-status profilepage-error">
    ❌ {error}
    <button onClick={() => window.location.reload()}>Retry</button>
  </div>
)}

5. Prevent Form State Loss

If the user edits something and switches tabs, they might lose unsaved changes.
Two options:

  • Autosave on blur of each field.

  • Prompt before leaving tab if there are unsaved changes.

If you want, I can rewrite this ProfilePage.jsx into a cleaner, optimized version with caching, reusable tabs, and a better UX so you can drop it in without losing functionality.
It will still use your current services (getUserProfile, createUserProfile) but be more maintainable.

setImagePreview(data.profileImageUrl || ""); } } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching profile:", error); setErrorMessage("Failed to load profile data."); } }, []); // Auth state change useEffect(() => { const unsubscribe = onAuthStateChanged(auth, (currentUser) => { if (!currentUser) { navigate("/login"); } else { setUser(currentUser); fetchProfile(currentUser.uid); } }); return () => unsubscribe(); }, [auth, fetchProfile, navigate]); // Track changes to enable/disable Save button useEffect(() => { if (!user) return; const changed = fieldsToCompare.some( (field) => (profileData[field] || "") !== (dbData[field] || "") ); const imageChanged = profileData.profileImageUrl !== (dbData.profileImageUrl || ""); setHasChanges(changed || imageChanged); }; checkChanges(); }, [profileData, user]); // Input change handler const handleChange = (e) => { const { name, value } = e.target; setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, [name]: value })); setHasChanges(true); }; // Validate image file before upload const validateFile = (file) => { if (!file) return "No file selected."; if (!ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES.includes(file.type)) return "Invalid file type. Only JPG, PNG, GIF, or WEBP allowed."; if (file.size > MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES) return "File too large. Max size is 2MB."; return null; }; // Handle image file input change const handleImageChange = async (e) => { setErrorMessage(""); const file = e.target.files[0]; const error = validateFile(file); if (error) { setErrorMessage(error); e.target.value = null; return; } // Show preview const reader = new FileReader(); reader.onload = (ev) => setImagePreview(ev.target.result); reader.readAsDataURL(file); // Upload to Firebase Storage and update profileImageUrl if (user && file) { try { const url = await uploadUserImage(user.uid, file); setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: url })); setHasChanges(true); } catch (uploadError) { console.error("Upload error:", uploadError); setErrorMessage("Failed to upload profile image."); } } }; // Remove profile image const handleRemoveImage = async () => { setErrorMessage(""); setSuccessMessage(""); if (!user) return; try { await deleteUserImage(user.uid); setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: "" })); setImagePreview(""); setHasChanges(true); } catch (error) { console.error("Remove image error:", error); setErrorMessage("Failed to remove profile image."); } }; // Validate required fields before save const validateProfile = () => { const requiredFields = ["fullName", "email", "phone", "year", "school", "group"]; for (const field of requiredFields) { if (!profileData[field] || profileData[field].trim() === "") { setErrorMessage(Please fill in the required field: ${field}); return false; } } setErrorMessage(""); return true; }; // Save profile changes const handleSave = async () => { if (!validateProfile()) return; if (!user) { setErrorMessage("No authenticated user."); return; } setIsSaving(true); setErrorMessage(""); setSuccessMessage(""); try { // We update firestore with the profileData including profileImageUrl await updateUserProfile(user.uid, { ...profileData, }); setSuccessMessage("Profile saved successfully!"); setHasChanges(false); } catch (error) { console.error("Save error:", error); setErrorMessage("Failed to save profile. Please try again."); } finally { setIsSaving(false); } }; // Fallback avatar: initials or static if no image const fallbackAvatar = null; // We use initials if no image // Compute initials from nickname or email prefix const getInitials = () => { if (profileData.nickname && profileData.nickname.trim().length > 0) { return profileData.nickname .split(" ") .map((w) => w[0]) .join("") .toUpperCase(); } if (user?.email) { return user.email.split("@")[0].slice(0, 2).toUpperCase(); } return "?"; }; const displayImage = imagePreview || profileData.profileImageUrl || fallbackAvatar; return ( <div className="profile-overview-container" role="main" aria-label="User Profile Overview"> <h2>Profile Overview</h2> {/* Profile Image */} <div className="profile-images" style={{ justifyContent: "center" }}> <div className="profile-avatar-wrapper" aria-label="User profile image or initials"> {displayImage ? ChatGPT said:

I see your ProfileOverview.jsx is already quite functional — it handles fetching, editing, validating, and saving profile data, plus uploading/removing profile pictures.
That said, there are a few optimizations and UX improvements that could make it cleaner, faster, and easier to maintain.

Main Observations & Improvements

1. Avoid Double Fetches

Currently, you:

  • Fetch profile in fetchProfile inside onAuthStateChanged.

  • Then fetch it again in the checkChanges effect to compare changes.

This means two Firestore reads almost every time.
A better approach is:

  • Store the fetched profile in a ref (originalProfileRef).

  • Compare form state against this ref instead of re-fetching.

jsx
const originalProfileRef = useRef(null);

const fetchProfile = useCallback(async (uid) => {
  try {
    const data = await getUserProfile(uid);
    if (data) {
      originalProfileRef.current = data;
      setProfileData({
        nickname: data.nickname || "",
        // ...rest of fields
      });
      setImagePreview(data.profileImageUrl || "");
    }
  } catch (error) {
    setErrorMessage("Failed to load profile data.");
  }
}, []);

useEffect(() => {
  if (!originalProfileRef.current) return;
  const changed = Object.keys(profileData).some(
    (key) => profileData[key] !== (originalProfileRef.current[key] || "")
  );
  setHasChanges(changed);
}, [profileData]);

✅ Result: No extra Firestore read.

2. Merge Duplicate State

You have profileData and imagePreview but both can be derived from a single profileData.profileImageUrl state.
The preview can be shown immediately after file select by setting it directly in profileData.

3. Better File Upload Flow

Right now, the image uploads immediately after selection. This can:

  • Cause unnecessary writes if the user changes their mind.

  • Make uploads fail if they cancel before saving other fields.

Alternative: Upload only when the user clicks "Save", just store the File object temporarily for preview.

4. Move Inline Styles to CSS

A lot of styles are inline (e.g., Save button, Remove button). Moving them to your ProfileOverview.css:

  • Improves readability

  • Makes them reusable

  • Keeps JSX cleaner

5. Loading Indicator for Image Upload

If the image is large, showing "Uploading..." or a spinner on the profile picture area would improve UX.

6. Validation UX

Currently, validation shows one message at a time.
Instead, you can highlight each empty required field directly using a red border:

jsx
className={`input-text ${errorFields.includes(name) ? "input-error" : ""}`}

CSS:

css
.input-error {
  border: 1px solid red;
}

7. Confirm Before Discard

If hasChanges is true and the user navigates away (switches tab or closes page), warn them:

jsx
useEffect(() => {
  const handleBeforeUnload = (e) => {
    if (hasChanges) {
      e.preventDefault();
      e.returnValue = "";
    }
  };
  window.addEventListener("beforeunload", handleBeforeUnload);
  return () => window.removeEventListener("beforeunload", handleBeforeUnload);
}, [hasChanges]);

If you’d like, I can rewrite this component so it:

  • Fetches once and compares locally

  • Uploads image only on save

  • Uses cleaner CSS classes instead of inline styles

  • Adds a proper unsaved-changes warning

This would make it much more efficient and production-ready without breaking your existing DB/storage logic.

ChatGPT said:

Got it ✅
Here’s a rewritten ProfileOverview.jsx that keeps your existing Firebase logic but:

  • Fetches only once (no double Firestore reads)

  • Stores original profile in a ref to check for changes locally

  • Uploads profile image only when saving (not immediately)

  • Moves inline styles to CSS classes for cleaner JSX

  • Adds unsaved changes warning when navigating away

  • Highlights empty required fields instead of showing one error at a time

jsx
// src/components/Profile/ProfileOverview.jsx
import React, { useState, useEffect, useCallback, useRef } from "react";
import { getAuth, onAuthStateChanged } from "firebase/auth";
import { getUserProfile, updateUserProfile } from "../../services/db";
import { uploadUserImage, deleteUserImage } from "../../services/storage";
import { useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import "../../styles/Profile/ProfileOverview.css";

const MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES = 2 * 1024 * 1024;
const ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES = ["image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/gif", "image/webp"];

export default function ProfileOverview() {
  const auth = getAuth();
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [profileData, setProfileData] = useState({
    nickname: "",
    fullName: "",
    email: "",
    phone: "",
    year: "",
    school: "",
    group: "",
    bio: "",
    interests: "",
    location: "",
    profileImageUrl: "",
  });

  const [tempImageFile, setTempImageFile] = useState(null);
  const [imagePreview, setImagePreview] = useState(null);

  const [errorMessage, setErrorMessage] = useState("");
  const [successMessage, setSuccessMessage] = useState("");
  const [isSaving, setIsSaving] = useState(false);
  const [hasChanges, setHasChanges] = useState(false);
  const [errorFields, setErrorFields] = useState([]);

  const fileInputRef = useRef(null);
  const originalProfileRef = useRef(null);

  // Fetch profile data
  const fetchProfile = useCallback(async (uid) => {
    try {
      const data = await getUserProfile(uid);
      if (data) {
        originalProfileRef.current = data;
        setProfileData({ ...profileData, ...data });
        setImagePreview(data.profileImageUrl || "");
      }
    } catch (error) {
      setErrorMessage("Failed to load profile data.");
    }
  }, []);

  // Auth state listener
  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = onAuthStateChanged(auth, (currentUser) => {
      if (!currentUser) return navigate("/login");
      setUser(currentUser);
      fetchProfile(currentUser.uid);
    });
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, [auth, fetchProfile, navigate]);

  // Detect unsaved changes locally
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!originalProfileRef.current) return;
    const changed = Object.keys(profileData).some(
      (key) => profileData[key] !== (originalProfileRef.current[key] || "")
    ) || !!tempImageFile;
    setHasChanges(changed);
  }, [profileData, tempImageFile]);

  // Warn before leaving with unsaved changes
  useEffect(() => {
    const handleBeforeUnload = (e) => {
      if (hasChanges) {
        e.preventDefault();
        e.returnValue = "";
      }
    };
    window.addEventListener("beforeunload", handleBeforeUnload);
    return () => window.removeEventListener("beforeunload", handleBeforeUnload);
  }, [hasChanges]);

  // Input change handler
  const handleChange = (e) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));
  };

  // Image selection (store locally, preview, upload later)
  const handleImageChange = (e) => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    const file = e.target.files[0];
    if (!file) return;

    if (!ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES.includes(file.type)) {
      setErrorMessage("Invalid file type. Only JPG, PNG, GIF, or WEBP allowed.");
      return;
    }
    if (file.size > MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES) {
      setErrorMessage("File too large. Max size is 2MB.");
      return;
    }

    setTempImageFile(file);
    setImagePreview(URL.createObjectURL(file));
  };

  // Remove image
  const handleRemoveImage = async () => {
    setTempImageFile(null);
    setImagePreview("");
    setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: "" }));
  };

  // Validate required fields
  const validateProfile = () => {
    const required = ["fullName", "email", "phone", "year", "school", "group"];
    const empty = required.filter((field) => !profileData[field]?.trim());
    setErrorFields(empty);
    return empty.length === 0;
  };

  // Save profile
  const handleSave = async () => {
    if (!validateProfile()) return;

    if (!user) return setErrorMessage("No authenticated user.");

    setIsSaving(true);
    setErrorMessage("");
    setSuccessMessage("");

    try {
      let updatedData = { ...profileData };

      // Upload image if changed
      if (tempImageFile) {
        const url = await uploadUserImage(user.uid, tempImageFile);
        updatedData.profileImageUrl = url;
      }

      await updateUserProfile(user.uid, updatedData);
      originalProfileRef.current = updatedData;
      setTempImageFile(null);
      setSuccessMessage("Profile saved successfully!");
      setHasChanges(false);
    } catch (error) {
      setErrorMessage("Failed to save profile. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setIsSaving(false);
    }
  };

  // Compute initials
  const getInitials = () => {
    if (profileData.nickname?.trim()) {
      return profileData.nickname.split(" ").map((w) => w[0]).join("").toUpperCase();
    }
    if (user?.email) return user.email.split("@")[0].slice(0, 2).toUpperCase();
    return "?";
  };

  return (
    <div className="profile-overview-container">
      <h2>Profile Overview</h2>

      {/* Profile Image */}
      <div className="profile-images">
        <div className="profile-avatar-wrapper">
          {imagePreview ? (
            <img src={imagePreview} alt="Profile avatar" className="profile-avatar" />
          ) : (
            <div className="initials-avatar">{getInitials()}</div>
          )}

          <input
            type="file"
            accept="image/*"
            onChange={handleImageChange}
            ref={fileInputRef}
            style={{ display: "none" }}
          />
          <label htmlFor="profile-upload" className="avatar-upload-label" onClick={() => fileInputRef.current.click()}>
            ✎
          </label>

          {imagePreview && (
            <button type="button" className="remove-btn" onClick={handleRemoveImage}>
              Remove
            </button>
          )}
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Fields */}
      {[
        { label: "Nickname", name: "nickname" },
        { label: "Full Name*", name: "fullName" },
        { label: "Email*", name: "email", type: "email" },
        { label: "Phone*", name: "phone", type: "tel" },
        { label: "Year*", name: "year" },
        { label: "School*", name: "school" },
        { label: "Group*", name: "group" },
      ].map(({ label, name, type = "text" }) => (
        <div key={name} className="form-group">
          <label>{label}</label>
          <input
            type={type}
            name={name}
            className={`input-text ${errorFields.includes(name) ? "input-error" : ""}`}
            value={profileData[name] || ""}
            onChange={handleChange}
          />
        </div>
      ))}

      {/* Bio */}
      <div className="form-group full-width">
        <label>Bio</label>
        <textarea name="bio" className="textarea-field" value={profileData.bio} onChange={handleChange} rows={4} />
      </div>

      {/* Interests */}
      <div className="form-group full-width">
        <label>Interests</label>
        <textarea
          name="interests"
          className="textarea-field"
          value={profileData.interests}
          onChange={handleChange}
          rows={3}
        />
      </div>

      {/* Location */}
      <div className="form-group full-width">
        <label>Location</label>
        <input type="text" name="location" className="input-text" value={profileData.location} onChange={handleChange} />
      </div>

      {/* Save Button */}
      <div className="save-section">
        <button
          onClick={handleSave}
          disabled={isSaving || !hasChanges}
          className={`save-btn ${isSaving || !hasChanges ? "disabled" : ""}`}
        >
          {isSaving ? "Saving..." : "Save Changes"}
        </button>

        {errorMessage && <p className="error-msg">{errorMessage}</p>}
        {successMessage && <p className="success-msg">{successMessage}</p>}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

I see what’s happening — your code here doesn’t actually have any icon imports or <Icon> elements, but the icons you’re seeing are probably coming from your CSS.
Most likely, the stylesheet (ProfilePreferences.css) is adding pseudo-elements (like ::before or ::after) to labels, headings, or list items to inject icons.

Here’s what you should do:

1. Check your CSS for icon injections

Look for rules in ProfilePreferences.css (or a global stylesheet) like:

css
label::before,
label::after,
h2::before,
h3::before {
  content: url('path-to-icon.svg'); /* or content: "\f007"; */
}

or

css
background: url('some-icon.png') no-repeat;

and remove or comment them out.

2. Ensure no icon font styles are applying

If you’re using something like Font Awesome or Material Icons globally, they may be automatically adding icons based on CSS selectors (like .switch-label:before or .select-label:before).
You can override them for this component by adding:

css
.profile-preferences-container *::before,
.profile-preferences-container *::after {
  content: none !important;
  background: none !important;
}

3. Scoped CSS fix

If you want to remove icons only in this preferences component, add this to ProfilePreferences.css:

css
.profile-preferences-container label::before,
.profile-preferences-container label::after,
.profile-preferences-container h2::before,
.profile-preferences-container h3::before {
  content: none !important;
  background: none !important;
}

That way, other parts of the site keep their icons, but this section stays clean.

// src/components/Profile/ProfilePreferences.jsx
import React from "react";
import "../../styles/Profile/ProfilePreferences.css";

const ProfilePreferences = ({ form, onChange, onRemoveImage }) => {
  const handleToggleNotifications = () => {
    onChange("notificationsEnabled", !form.notificationsEnabled);
  };

  const handleThemeChange = (e) => {
    onChange("themePreference", e.target.value);
  };

  return (
    <div className="profile-preferences-container">
      <h2>Preferences & Privacy</h2>

      {/* Profile Picture & Remove Button */}
      <section className="profile-picture-section">
        <div className="avatar-wrapper">
          <img
            src={form.profileImage || "/default-avatar.png"}
            alt="Profile"
            className="avatar-preview"
          />
        </div>
        <button
          type="button"
          className="remove-image-btn"
          onClick={onRemoveImage}
        >
          Remove Image
        </button>
      </section>

      {/* Notifications */}
      <section className="preference-section">
        <label className="switch-label">
          <input
            type="checkbox"
            checked={form.notificationsEnabled}
            onChange={handleToggleNotifications}
          />
          <span className="slider" />
          Enable Notifications
        </label>
        <p className="helper-text">
          Turn notifications on or off to control if you want to receive updates.
        </p>
      </section>

      {/* Theme Preference */}
      <section className="preference-section">
        <label htmlFor="themePreference" className="select-label">
          Theme Preference
        </label>
        <select
          id="themePreference"
          value={form.themePreference}
          onChange={handleThemeChange}
          className="select-field"
        >
          <option value="auto">Auto (Follow system)</option>
          <option value="light">Light</option>
          <option value="dark">Dark</option>
        </select>
      </section>

      {/* Privacy */}
      <section className="preference-section">
        <h3>Privacy Settings</h3>
        <p>Coming soon: Control your visibility, data sharing, and privacy preferences.</p>
      </section>

      {/* Disclaimer */}
      <section className="disclaimer-section">
        <h4>Disclaimer</h4>
        <p>
          All information collected in this profile is used solely to personalize your experience within Stratizen,
          including messaging, notifications, and content delivery. We respect your privacy and
          will not share your data with third parties without your consent.
        </p>
      </section>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ProfilePreferences;

Please try again."); } finally { setIsSaving(false); } }; // Fallback avatar image URL for when no profile image const fallbackAvatar = ""; // Generate initials from full name or nickname const getInitials = () => { const sourceName = profileData.fullName || profileData.nickname || "U"; const names = sourceName.trim().split(" "); if (names.length === 1) return names[0].charAt(0).toUpperCase(); return ( names[0].charAt(0).toUpperCase() + names[1].charAt(0).toUpperCase() ); }; // Generate a random pastel background color based on user ID (for consistent color) const getRandomPastelColor = (seed) => { let hash = 0; for (let i = 0; i < seed.length; i++) { hash = seed.charCodeAt(i) + ((hash << 5) - hash); } const h = hash % 360; return hsl(${h}, 70%, 80%); }; const initialsBgColor = user ? getRandomPastelColor(user.uid) : "#cccccc"; // Image or initials display const displayImage = imagePreview || profileData.profileImageUrl || fallbackAvatar; return ( <div className="profile-overview-container-wrapper"> <div className="profile-overview-container" role="main" aria-label="User Profile Overview"> <h2 className="profile-title">Profile Overview</h2> {/* Profile Image with edit/remove outside */} <div className="profile-images" style={{ justifyContent: "center" }}> <div className="profile-avatar-wrapper" aria-label="User profile image or initials"> {displayImage ? Here’s the relevant change in your render section:

jsx
<div className="profile-avatar-wrapper" aria-label="User profile image or initials">
  {displayImage ? (
    <img
      src={displayImage}
      alt="Profile avatar"
      className="profile-avatar"
      loading="lazy"
    />
  ) : (
    <div
      className="initials-avatar"
      aria-label="User initials avatar"
      style={{ backgroundColor: initialsBgColor }}
    >
      {getInitials()}
    </div>
  )}

  <input
    type="file"
    id="profile-upload"
    accept="image/*"
    onChange={handleImageChange}
    ref={fileInputRef}
    style={{ display: "none" }}
  />

  {/* Upload button stays here */}
  <div className="profile-image-actions">
    <label
      htmlFor="profile-upload"
      className="icon-button edit-button"
      tabIndex={0}
      aria-label="Upload new profile image"
    >
      ✎
    </label>
  </div>

  {/* Remove button moved BELOW the image */}
  {displayImage && displayImage !== fallbackAvatar && (
    <div style={{ marginTop: "0.5rem", textAlign: "center" }}>
      <button
        type="button"
        onClick={handleRemoveImage}
        className="icon-button remove-button"
        aria-label="Remove profile image"
      >
        × Remove Image
      </button>
    </div>
  )}
</div>

Key changes:

  • The remove button is now outside .profile-image-actions and placed after the image block.

  • Wrapped it in a div with marginTop and textAlign: "center" for clean spacing and alignment.

  • Changed label to "× Remove Image" for better clarity (you can keep it just "×" if you want).

Got it ✅ — you want the remove button below the profile picture and the pencil (edit) icon’s Unicode fixed so it isn’t trimmed.
Here’s your updated ProfileOverview.jsx with the layout change but without altering any logic:

jsx
// src/components/Profile/ProfileOverview.jsx
import React, { useState, useEffect, useCallback, useRef } from "react";
import { getAuth, onAuthStateChanged } from "firebase/auth";
import { getUserProfile, updateUserProfile } from "../../services/db";
import { uploadUserImage, deleteUserImage } from "../../services/storage";
import { useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import "../../styles/Profile/ProfileOverview.css";

const MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES = 2 * 1024 * 1024; // 2MB
const ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES = ["image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/gif", "image/webp"];

export default function ProfileOverview() {
  const auth = getAuth();
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [profileData, setProfileData] = useState({
    nickname: "",
    fullName: "",
    email: "",
    phone: "",
    year: "",
    school: "",
    group: "",
    bio: "",
    interests: "",
    location: "",
    profileImageUrl: "",
  });
  const [imagePreview, setImagePreview] = useState(null);
  const [errorMessage, setErrorMessage] = useState("");
  const [successMessage, setSuccessMessage] = useState("");
  const [isSaving, setIsSaving] = useState(false);
  const [hasChanges, setHasChanges] = useState(false);

  const fileInputRef = useRef(null);

  const fetchProfile = useCallback(async (uid) => {
    try {
      const data = await getUserProfile(uid);
      if (data) {
        setProfileData({
          nickname: data.nickname || "",
          fullName: data.fullName || "",
          email: data.email || "",
          phone: data.phone || "",
          year: data.year || "",
          school: data.school || "",
          group: data.group || "",
          bio: data.bio || "",
          interests: data.interests || "",
          location: data.location || "",
          profileImageUrl: data.profileImageUrl || "",
        });
        setImagePreview(data.profileImageUrl || "");
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error fetching profile:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to load profile data.");
    }
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = onAuthStateChanged(auth, (currentUser) => {
      if (!currentUser) {
        navigate("/login");
      } else {
        setUser(currentUser);
        fetchProfile(currentUser.uid);
      }
    });
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, [auth, fetchProfile, navigate]);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!user) return;

    const checkChanges = async () => {
      const dbData = await getUserProfile(user.uid);
      if (!dbData) {
        setHasChanges(true);
        return;
      }

      const fieldsToCompare = [
        "nickname",
        "fullName",
        "email",
        "phone",
        "year",
        "school",
        "group",
        "bio",
        "interests",
        "location",
      ];

      const changed = fieldsToCompare.some(
        (field) => (profileData[field] || "") !== (dbData[field] || "")
      );

      const imageChanged = profileData.profileImageUrl !== (dbData.profileImageUrl || "");

      setHasChanges(changed || imageChanged);
    };

    checkChanges();
  }, [profileData, user]);

  const handleChange = (e) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));
    setHasChanges(true);
  };

  const validateFile = (file) => {
    if (!file) return "No file selected.";
    if (!ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES.includes(file.type)) return "Invalid file type. Only JPG, PNG, GIF, WEBP allowed.";
    if (file.size > MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES) return "File too large. Max size is 2MB.";
    return null;
  };

  const handleImageChange = async (e) => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    const file = e.target.files[0];
    const error = validateFile(file);
    if (error) {
      setErrorMessage(error);
      e.target.value = null;
      return;
    }

    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.onload = (ev) => setImagePreview(ev.target.result);
    reader.readAsDataURL(file);

    if (user && file) {
      try {
        const url = await uploadUserImage(user.uid, file);
        setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: url }));
        setHasChanges(true);
      } catch (uploadError) {
        console.error("Upload error:", uploadError);
        setErrorMessage("Failed to upload profile image.");
      }
    }
  };

  const handleRemoveImage = async () => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    setSuccessMessage("");
    if (!user) return;

    try {
      await deleteUserImage(user.uid);
      setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: "" }));
      setImagePreview("");
      setHasChanges(true);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Remove image error:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to remove profile image.");
    }
  };

  const validateProfile = () => {
    const requiredFields = ["fullName", "email", "phone", "year", "school", "group"];
    for (const field of requiredFields) {
      if (!profileData[field] || profileData[field].trim() === "") {
        setErrorMessage(`Please fill in the required field: ${field}`);
        return false;
      }
    }
    setErrorMessage("");
    return true;
  };

  const handleSave = async () => {
    if (!validateProfile()) return;
    if (!user) {
      setErrorMessage("No authenticated user.");
      return;
    }

    setIsSaving(true);
    setErrorMessage("");
    setSuccessMessage("");

    try {
      await updateUserProfile(user.uid, {
        ...profileData,
      });
      setSuccessMessage("Profile saved successfully!");
      setHasChanges(false);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Save error:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to save profile. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setIsSaving(false);
    }
  };

  const fallbackAvatar = "";

  const getInitials = () => {
    const sourceName = profileData.fullName || profileData.nickname || "U";
    const names = sourceName.trim().split(" ");
    if (names.length === 1) return names[0].charAt(0).toUpperCase();
    return names[0].charAt(0).toUpperCase() + names[1].charAt(0).toUpperCase();
  };

  const getRandomPastelColor = (seed) => {
    let hash = 0;
    for (let i = 0; i < seed.length; i++) {
      hash = seed.charCodeAt(i) + ((hash << 5) - hash);
    }
    const h = hash % 360;
    return `hsl(${h}, 70%, 80%)`;
  };

  const initialsBgColor = user ? getRandomPastelColor(user.uid) : "#cccccc";
  const displayImage = imagePreview || profileData.profileImageUrl || fallbackAvatar;

  return (
    <div className="profile-overview-container-wrapper">
      <div className="profile-overview-container" role="main" aria-label="User Profile Overview">
        <h2 className="profile-title">Profile Overview</h2>

        <div className="profile-images" style={{ justifyContent: "center" }}>
          <div className="profile-avatar-wrapper" aria-label="User profile image or initials">
            {displayImage ? (
              <img src={displayImage} alt="Profile avatar" className="profile-avatar" loading="lazy" />
            ) : (
              <div className="initials-avatar" aria-label="User initials avatar" style={{ backgroundColor: initialsBgColor }}>
                {getInitials()}
              </div>
            )}

            <input type="file" id="profile-upload" accept="image/*" onChange={handleImageChange} ref={fileInputRef} style={{ display: "none" }} />

            <div className="profile-image-actions" style={{ display: "flex", flexDirection: "column", alignItems: "center", gap: "0.5rem", marginTop: "0.5rem" }}>
              <label htmlFor="profile-upload" className="icon-button edit-button" tabIndex={0} aria-label="Upload new profile image">
                &#9998;
              </label>

              {displayImage && displayImage !== fallbackAvatar && (
                <button type="button" onClick={handleRemoveImage} className="icon-button remove-button" aria-label="Remove profile image">
                  ×
                </button>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

        {/* Form fields */}
        <div className="form-fields-container">
          {[
            { label: "Nickname", name: "nickname", type: "text" },
            { label: "Full Name*", name: "fullName", type: "text" },
            { label: "Email*", name: "email", type: "email" },
            { label: "Phone*", name: "phone", type: "tel" },
            { label: "Year*", name: "year", type: "text" },
            { label: "School*", name: "school", type: "text" },
            { label: "Group*", name: "group", type: "text" },
            { label: "Bio", name: "bio", type: "textarea" },
            { label: "Interests", name: "interests", type: "textarea" },
            { label: "Location", name: "location", type: "text" },
          ].map(({ label, name, type }) => (
            <div className="form-group" key={name}>
              <label className="form-label" htmlFor={name}>
                {label}
              </label>
              {type === "textarea" ? (
                <textarea id={name} name={name} className="textarea-field" value={profileData[name]} onChange={handleChange} rows={name === "bio" ? 4 : 3} />
              ) : (
                <input id={name} type={type} name={name} className="input-text" value={profileData[name]} onChange={handleChange} aria-required={name !== "nickname"} aria-invalid={errorMessage.includes(name) ? "true" : "false"} />
              )}
            </div>
          ))}
        </div>

        {/* Save button */}
        <div style={{ textAlign: "center", marginTop: "1.5rem" }}>
          <button
            onClick={handleSave}
            disabled={isSaving || !hasChanges}
            style={{
              backgroundColor: isSaving || !hasChanges ? "#a5b4fc" : "#2563eb",
              color: "white",
              padding: "0.6rem 1.2rem",
              border: "none",
              borderRadius: "6px",
              cursor: isSaving || !hasChanges ? "not-allowed" : "pointer",
              fontSize: "1rem",
              transition: "background-color 0.3s ease",
            }}
            aria-disabled={isSaving || !hasChanges}
          >
            {isSaving ? "Saving..." : "Save Changes"}
          </button>

          {errorMessage && <p style={{ color: "red", marginTop: "0.8rem", fontSize: "0.9rem", fontWeight: "600" }} role="alert">{errorMessage}</p>}
          {successMessage && <p style={{ color: "green", marginTop: "0.8rem", fontSize: "0.9rem", fontWeight: "600" }} role="status">{successMessage}</p>}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

Changes made:

  • Moved the remove (×) button below the profile image, stacking both buttons vertically.

  • Kept all original logic intact.

ChatGPT said:

Sure! I removed the <div className="profile-avatar-wrapper"> wrapper and placed the profile avatar and the image action buttons (edit and remove) as separate siblings inside the profile-images container. Here's your updated full .jsx with that change and the previous fixes intact:

jsx
// src/components/Profile/ProfileOverview.jsx
import React, { useState, useEffect, useCallback, useRef } from "react";
import { getAuth, onAuthStateChanged } from "firebase/auth";
import { getUserProfile, updateUserProfile } from "../../services/db";
import { uploadUserImage, deleteUserImage } from "../../services/storage";
import { useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import "../../styles/Profile/ProfileOverview.css";

const MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES = 2 * 1024 * 1024; // 2MB
const ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES = ["image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/gif", "image/webp"];

export default function ProfileOverview() {
  const auth = getAuth();
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [profileData, setProfileData] = useState({
    nickname: "",
    fullName: "",
    email: "",
    phone: "",
    year: "",
    school: "",
    group: "",
    bio: "",
    interests: "",
    location: "",
    profileImageUrl: "",
  });
  const [imagePreview, setImagePreview] = useState(null);
  const [errorMessage, setErrorMessage] = useState("");
  const [successMessage, setSuccessMessage] = useState("");
  const [isSaving, setIsSaving] = useState(false);
  const [hasChanges, setHasChanges] = useState(false);

  const fileInputRef = useRef(null);

  const fetchProfile = useCallback(async (uid) => {
    try {
      const data = await getUserProfile(uid);
      if (data) {
        setProfileData({
          nickname: data.nickname || "",
          fullName: data.fullName || "",
          email: data.email || "",
          phone: data.phone || "",
          year: data.year || "",
          school: data.school || "",
          group: data.group || "",
          bio: data.bio || "",
          interests: data.interests || "",
          location: data.location || "",
          profileImageUrl: data.profileImageUrl || "",
        });
        setImagePreview(data.profileImageUrl || "");
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error fetching profile:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to load profile data.");
    }
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = onAuthStateChanged(auth, (currentUser) => {
      if (!currentUser) {
        navigate("/login");
      } else {
        setUser(currentUser);
        fetchProfile(currentUser.uid);
      }
    });
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, [auth, fetchProfile, navigate]);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!user) return;

    const checkChanges = async () => {
      const dbData = await getUserProfile(user.uid);
      if (!dbData) {
        setHasChanges(true);
        return;
      }

      const fieldsToCompare = [
        "nickname",
        "fullName",
        "email",
        "phone",
        "year",
        "school",
        "group",
        "bio",
        "interests",
        "location",
      ];

      const changed = fieldsToCompare.some(
        (field) => (profileData[field] || "") !== (dbData[field] || "")
      );

      const imageChanged = profileData.profileImageUrl !== (dbData.profileImageUrl || "");

      setHasChanges(changed || imageChanged);
    };

    checkChanges();
  }, [profileData, user]);

  const handleChange = (e) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));
    setHasChanges(true);
  };

  const validateFile = (file) => {
    if (!file) return "No file selected.";
    if (!ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES.includes(file.type)) return "Invalid file type. Only JPG, PNG, GIF, WEBP allowed.";
    if (file.size > MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES) return "File too large. Max size is 2MB.";
    return null;
  };

  const handleImageChange = async (e) => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    const file = e.target.files[0];
    const error = validateFile(file);
    if (error) {
      setErrorMessage(error);
      e.target.value = null;
      return;
    }

    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.onload = (ev) => setImagePreview(ev.target.result);
    reader.readAsDataURL(file);

    if (user && file) {
      try {
        const url = await uploadUserImage(user.uid, file);
        setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: url }));
        setHasChanges(true);
      } catch (uploadError) {
        console.error("Upload error:", uploadError);
        setErrorMessage("Failed to upload profile image.");
      }
    }
  };

  const handleRemoveImage = async () => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    setSuccessMessage("");
    if (!user) return;

    try {
      await deleteUserImage(user.uid);
      setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: "" }));
      setImagePreview("");
      setHasChanges(true);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Remove image error:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to remove profile image.");
    }
  };

  const validateProfile = () => {
    const requiredFields = ["fullName", "email", "phone", "year", "school", "group"];
    for (const field of requiredFields) {
      if (!profileData[field] || profileData[field].trim() === "") {
        setErrorMessage(`Please fill in the required field: ${field}`);
        return false;
      }
    }
    setErrorMessage("");
    return true;
  };

  const handleSave = async () => {
    if (!validateProfile()) return;
    if (!user) {
      setErrorMessage("No authenticated user.");
      return;
    }

    setIsSaving(true);
    setErrorMessage("");
    setSuccessMessage("");

    try {
      await updateUserProfile(user.uid, {
        ...profileData,
      });
      setSuccessMessage("Profile saved successfully!");
      setHasChanges(false);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Save error:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to save profile. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setIsSaving(false);
    }
  };

  const fallbackAvatar = "";

  const getInitials = () => {
    const sourceName = profileData.fullName || profileData.nickname || "U";
    const names = sourceName.trim().split(" ");
    if (names.length === 1) return names[0].charAt(0).toUpperCase();
    return names[0].charAt(0).toUpperCase() + names[1].charAt(0).toUpperCase();
  };

  const getRandomPastelColor = (seed) => {
    let hash = 0;
    for (let i = 0; i < seed.length; i++) {
      hash = seed.charCodeAt(i) + ((hash << 5) - hash);
    }
    const h = hash % 360;
    return `hsl(${h}, 70%, 80%)`;
  };

  const initialsBgColor = user ? getRandomPastelColor(user.uid) : "#cccccc";
  const displayImage = imagePreview || profileData.profileImageUrl || fallbackAvatar;

  return (
    <div className="profile-overview-container-wrapper">
      <div className="profile-overview-container" role="main" aria-label="User Profile Overview">
        <h2 className="profile-title">Profile Overview</h2>

        <div className="profile-images" style={{ justifyContent: "center", display: "flex", flexDirection: "column", alignItems: "center" }}>
          {displayImage ? (
            <img src={displayImage} alt="Profile avatar" className="profile-avatar" loading="lazy" />
          ) : (
            <div className="initials-avatar" aria-label="User initials avatar" style={{ backgroundColor: initialsBgColor }}>
              {getInitials()}
            </div>
          )}

          <input
            type="file"
            id="profile-upload"
            accept="image/*"
            onChange={handleImageChange}
            ref={fileInputRef}
            style={{ display: "none" }}
          />

          <div className="profile-image-actions" style={{ display: "flex", flexDirection: "column", alignItems: "center", gap: "0.5rem", marginTop: "0.5rem" }}>
            <label
              htmlFor="profile-upload"
              className="icon-button edit-button"
              tabIndex={0}
              aria-label="Upload new profile image"
            >
              &#9998;
            </label>

            {displayImage && displayImage !== fallbackAvatar && (
              <button
                type="button"
                onClick={handleRemoveImage}
                className="icon-button remove-button"
                aria-label="Remove profile image"
              >
                ×
              </button>
            )}
          </div>
        </div>

        {/* Form fields */}
        <div className="form-fields-container">
          {[
            { label: "Nickname", name: "nickname", type: "text" },
            { label: "Full Name*", name: "fullName", type: "text" },
            { label: "Email*", name: "email", type: "email" },
            { label: "Phone*", name: "phone", type: "tel" },
            { label: "Year*", name: "year", type: "text" },
            { label: "School*", name: "school", type: "text" },
            { label: "Group*", name: "group", type: "text" },
            { label: "Bio", name: "bio", type: "textarea" },
            { label: "Interests", name: "interests", type: "textarea" },
            { label: "Location", name: "location", type: "text" },
          ].map(({ label, name, type }) => (
            <div className="form-group" key={name}>
              <label className="form-label" htmlFor={name}>
                {label}
              </label>
              {type === "textarea" ? (
                <textarea id={name} name={name} className="textarea-field" value={profileData[name]} onChange={handleChange} rows={name === "bio" ? 4 : 3} />
              ) : (
                <input id={name} type={type} name={name} className="input-text" value={profileData[name]} onChange={handleChange} aria-required={name !== "nickname"} aria-invalid={errorMessage.includes(name) ? "true" : "false"} />
              )}
            </div>
          ))}
        </div>

        {/* Save button */}
        <div style={{ textAlign: "center", marginTop: "1.5rem" }}>
          <button
            onClick={handleSave}
            disabled={isSaving || !hasChanges}
            style={{
              backgroundColor: isSaving || !hasChanges ? "#a5b4fc" : "#2563eb",
              color: "white",
              padding: "0.6rem 1.2rem",
              border: "none",
              borderRadius: "6px",
              cursor: isSaving || !hasChanges ? "not-allowed" : "pointer",
              fontSize: "1rem",
              transition: "background-color 0.3s ease",
            }}
            aria-disabled={isSaving || !hasChanges}
          >
            {isSaving ? "Saving..." : "Save Changes"}
          </button>

          {errorMessage && <p style={{ color: "red", marginTop: "0.8rem", fontSize: "0.9rem", fontWeight: "600" }} role="alert">{errorMessage}</p>}
          {successMessage && <p style={{ color: "green", marginTop: "0.8rem", fontSize: "0.9rem", fontWeight: "600" }} role="status">{successMessage}</p>}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

Got it! Since you removed the .profile-avatar-wrapper div in your JSX, we need to adjust CSS so that the avatar image or initials stay circular, centered, and nicely styled without that wrapper. Here's the updated .css for ProfileOverview.css with those requirements:

css
/* src/styles/Profile/ProfileOverview.css */

/* ---------- GLOBAL STYLING ---------- */
:root {
  --primary: #00205B; /* Strathmore Blue */
  --accent: #FFC72C; /* Gold */
  --danger: #E31C3D; /* Red */
  --bg-light: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.85);
  --shadow-strong: 0 12px 30px rgba(0, 32, 91, 0.18);
  --shadow-soft: 0 6px 18px rgba(0, 32, 91, 0.12);
  --radius-lg: 20px;
  --radius-md: 12px;
}

/* ---------- CONTAINER ---------- */
.profile-overview-container {
  max-width: 760px;
  margin: 2.5rem auto;
  padding: 2.5rem;
  background: var(--bg-light);
  border-radius: var(--radius-lg);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-strong);
  backdrop-filter: blur(14px) saturate(160%);
  font-family: "Segoe UI", Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
  color: var(--primary);
  border-top: 6px solid var(--accent);
  animation: fadeInUp 0.6s ease-out;
}

    transform: translateY(20px);
    opacity: 0;
  }
  to {

    opacity: 1;
  }

  flex-direction: column;

}

/* Avatar Image or Initials styles */
.profile-avatar,
.initials-avatar {
  width: 160px;
  height: 160px;
  border-radius: 50%;

  background: linear-gradient(145deg, #f8f9fa, #e3e4e8);
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-soft);
  display: flex;

  justify-content: center;
  font-weight: 700;
  font-size: 5rem;
  color: var(--primary);
  user-select: none;
  transition: transform 0.35s ease, box-shadow 0.35s ease;
  border: 4px solid white;
  object-fit: cover;
}

.profile-avatar:hover,
.initials-avatar:hover {
  transform: scale(1.06);
  box-shadow: 0 8px 24px rgba(0, 32, 91, 0.28);
}

/* If .profile-avatar is an img, ensure object-fit */
.profile-avatar {
  object-fit: cover;
  font-size: initial; /* reset font size for img */
  color: initial;
}

/* Edit and Remove Buttons Container */
.profile-image-actions {
  display: flex;
  gap: 16px;
  justify-content: center;
  margin-top: 8px;
}

/* Icon Buttons */
.icon-button {
  width: 40px;
  height: 40px;
  background: var(--accent);
  color: var(--primary);
  border-radius: 50%;
  font-size: 22px;
  font-weight: 700;
  line-height: 1;
  cursor: pointer;
  border: none;
  box-shadow: var(--shadow-soft);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  transition: all 0.3s ease;
}

.icon-button:hover,
.icon-button:focus {
  background: var(--danger);
  color: white;
  transform: scale(1.1) rotate(10deg);
  outline: none;
}

/* ---------- FORM ---------- */
.form-fields-container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(280px, 1fr));
  gap: 1.8rem 2.2rem;
}

  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  margin-bottom: 1.8rem;

ChatGPT said:

To save the profile photo and also update the user's profile document in the database with the image URL (so it can be fetched and reused across your platform), you want to:

  1. Upload the image to Firebase Storage (which you already do).

  2. After upload succeeds and you get the download URL, update the Firestore user profile document to save that URL.

  3. This way, when you fetch profile data, it includes the profile image URL.

Assuming your Firestore user profile service looks like this (in db.js or similar):

js
import { doc, updateDoc } from "firebase/firestore";
import { getFirestore } from "firebase/firestore";
import { app } from "./firebase";

const db = getFirestore(app);

export async function updateUserProfile(uid, data) {
  if (!uid) throw new Error("UID required");
  const userDoc = doc(db, "users", uid);
  await updateDoc(userDoc, data);
}

Here’s how to update your storage upload function (or make a new helper) to save the image and update Firestore:

js
import { uploadUserImage } from "./storage";
import { updateUserProfile } from "./db";

/**
 * Uploads user profile photo, then updates Firestore user profile doc with image URL.
 *
 * @param {string} uid
 * @param {File} file
 * @returns {Promise<string>} - resolves to the image download URL
 */
export async function saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB(uid, file) {
  if (!uid) throw new Error("UID is required");
  if (!file) throw new Error("File is required");

  // 1. Upload image to Storage (using your existing function)
  const imageUrl = await uploadUserImage(uid, file, "profilePicture");

  // 2. Update Firestore user profile document with the new image URL
  await updateUserProfile(uid, { profileImageUrl: imageUrl });

  // 3. Return the image URL for further use (e.g., show preview)
  return imageUrl;
}

How to integrate in your component:

Replace wherever you upload the profile image:

js
// In ProfileOverview.jsx's handleImageChange or equivalent:

const url = await saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB(user.uid, file);
setProfileData(prev => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: url }));
setHasChanges(true);

Summary:

  • Upload image → get URL

  • Update Firestore profile with { profileImageUrl: url }

  • Return URL so you can update UI state

This pattern ensures your profile photo is persisted in Storage and referenced in Firestore for reuse anywhere in your app.

import { uploadUserImage } from "./storage";
import { updateUserProfile } from "./db";

/**
 * Uploads user profile photo, updates Firestore profile with photo URL.
 * @param {string} uid
 * @param {File} file
 * @returns {Promise<string>} The image download URL
 */
export async function saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB(uid, file) {
  if (!uid) throw new Error("UID is required");
  if (!file) throw new Error("File is required");

  // Upload image to Storage (under 'profilePicture' key)
  const imageUrl = await uploadUserImage(uid, file, "profilePicture");

  await updateUserProfile(uid, { profilePicture: imageUrl });

  return imageUrl;

Step 2: Update ProfileOverview.jsx to use this helper

import { saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB } from "../../services/storage"; // or wherever you put it

const handleImageChange = async (e) => {
  setErrorMessage("");
  const file = e.target.files[0];
  const error = validateFile(file);
  if (error) {
    setErrorMessage(error);
    e.target.value = null;
    return;
  }

  // Show preview immediately
  const reader = new FileReader();
  reader.onload = (ev) => setImagePreview(ev.target.result);
  reader.readAsDataURL(file);

  if (user && file) {
    try {
      // Upload & update Firestore profile picture URL
      const url = await saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB(user.uid, file);
      // Update state with new profile picture URL (from Firestore)
      setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: url }));
      setHasChanges(false); // no unsaved changes after direct update
      setSuccessMessage("Profile photo updated successfully!");
    } catch (uploadError) {
      console.error("Upload error:", uploadError);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to upload profile image.");
    }
  }
};

js
const handleRemoveImage = async () => {
  setErrorMessage("");
  setSuccessMessage("");
  if (!user) return;

  try {
    // Delete the profile picture from Storage
    await deleteUserImage(user.uid, "profilePicture");

    // Remove from Firestore user profile
    await updateUserProfile(user.uid, { profilePicture: "" });

    setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: "" }));
    setImagePreview("");
    setHasChanges(false);
    setSuccessMessage("Profile photo removed.");
  } catch (error) {
    console.error("Remove image error:", error);
    setErrorMessage("Failed to remove profile image.");
  }
};

ChatGPT said:

Here is the fully updated storage.js with the added helper that uploads a user profile photo, updates the Firestore user profile with the photo URL, and all your existing functionality:

js
// src/services/storage.js
import { getStorage, ref, uploadBytesResumable, getDownloadURL, deleteObject } from "firebase/storage";
import { app } from "./firebase"; // uses the same firebase app instance
import { updateUserProfile } from "./db"; // import your Firestore update helper

// Config
export const VALID_IMAGE_TYPES = ["image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/gif", "image/webp"];
export const IMAGE_MAX_SIZE = 2 * 1024 * 1024; // 2 MB

const storage = getStorage(app);

/**
 * Validate an image file (type + size).
 * @param {File} file
 * @param {number} maxSize
 * @returns {boolean}
 */
export function validateImageFile(file, maxSize = IMAGE_MAX_SIZE) {
  if (!file) return false;
  if (!VALID_IMAGE_TYPES.includes(file.type)) return false;
  if (file.size > maxSize) return false;
  return true;
}

/**
 * Upload a user image to Storage and return the download URL.
 *
 * @param {string} uid - user id
 * @param {File} file - File object from input
 * @param {string} imageKey - storage filename/key (e.g. "profilePicture" or "coverPhoto")
 * @param {(progress:number, snapshot?:object)=>void} onProgress - optional progress callback (0-100)
 * @returns {Promise<string>} download URL
 */
export async function uploadUserImage(uid, file, imageKey = "profilePicture", onProgress) {
  if (!uid) throw new Error("UID is required");
  if (!file) throw new Error("File is required");

  if (!validateImageFile(file)) {
    throw new Error("Invalid file: only jpeg/png/gif/webp under 2MB allowed");
  }

  const storageRef = ref(storage, `users/${uid}/${imageKey}`);
  const metadata = { contentType: file.type };

  const uploadTask = uploadBytesResumable(storageRef, file, metadata);

  return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    uploadTask.on(
      "state_changed",
      (snapshot) => {
        const progress = (snapshot.bytesTransferred / snapshot.totalBytes) * 100;
        if (typeof onProgress === "function") onProgress(Math.round(progress), snapshot);
      },
      (error) => {
        reject(error);
      },
      async () => {
        try {
          const url = await getDownloadURL(uploadTask.snapshot.ref);
          resolve(url);
        } catch (err) {
          reject(err);
        }
      }
    );
  });
}

/**
 * Delete a user's image from Storage.
 * @param {string} uid
 * @param {string} imageKey
 * @returns {Promise<void>}
 */
export async function deleteUserImage(uid, imageKey = "profilePicture") {
  if (!uid) throw new Error("UID is required");
  const storageRef = ref(storage, `users/${uid}/${imageKey}`);
  await deleteObject(storageRef);
}

/**
 * Get download URL for an existing user image.
 * @param {string} uid
 * @param {string} imageKey
 * @returns {Promise<string>} download URL
 */
export async function getUserImageUrl(uid, imageKey = "profilePicture") {
  if (!uid) throw new Error("UID is required");
  const storageRef = ref(storage, `users/${uid}/${imageKey}`);
  return await getDownloadURL(storageRef);
}

/**
 * Upload user profile photo and update Firestore user profile.
 * @param {string} uid
 * @param {File} file
 * @returns {Promise<string>} download URL
 */
export async function saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB(uid, file) {
  if (!uid) throw new Error("UID is required");
  if (!file) throw new Error("File is required");

  // Upload image to Storage (under 'profilePicture' key)
  const imageUrl = await uploadUserImage(uid, file, "profilePicture");

  // Update Firestore profile document with new profilePicture URL
  await updateUserProfile(uid, { profilePicture: imageUrl });

  return imageUrl;
}

How to use:

  • Import and call saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB(uid, file) in your React component when user selects a new profile image.

  • It uploads to Firebase Storage, then updates Firestore profilePicture field atomically.

  • The function returns the new image URL.

If you want me to update your React component next or anything else, just ask!

Got it! I'll update your ProfileOverview.jsx to:

  • Use the new saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB function from your updated storage.js to upload the profile photo and update Firestore in one go.

  • Clean up the image upload logic accordingly.

  • Keep the rest of your form handling intact.

  • Maintain accessibility and responsiveness.

Here’s your updated component with the integrated profile photo upload & Firestore update:

jsx
// src/components/Profile/ProfileOverview.jsx
import React, { useState, useEffect, useCallback, useRef } from "react";
import { getAuth, onAuthStateChanged } from "firebase/auth";
import { getUserProfile, updateUserProfile } from "../../services/db";
import { saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB, deleteUserImage } from "../../services/storage";
import { useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import "../../styles/Profile/ProfileOverview.css";

const MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES = 2 * 1024 * 1024; // 2MB
const ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES = ["image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/gif", "image/webp"];

export default function ProfileOverview() {
  const auth = getAuth();
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [profileData, setProfileData] = useState({
    nickname: "",
    fullName: "",
    email: "",
    phone: "",
    year: "",
    school: "",
    group: "",
    bio: "",
    interests: "",
    location: "",
    profileImageUrl: "",
  });
  const [imagePreview, setImagePreview] = useState(null);
  const [errorMessage, setErrorMessage] = useState("");
  const [successMessage, setSuccessMessage] = useState("");
  const [isSaving, setIsSaving] = useState(false);
  const [hasChanges, setHasChanges] = useState(false);

  const fileInputRef = useRef(null);

  const fetchProfile = useCallback(async (uid) => {
    try {
      const data = await getUserProfile(uid);
      if (data) {
        setProfileData({
          nickname: data.nickname || "",
          fullName: data.fullName || "",
          email: data.email || "",
          phone: data.phone || "",
          year: data.year || "",
          school: data.school || "",
          group: data.group || "",
          bio: data.bio || "",
          interests: data.interests || "",
          location: data.location || "",
          profileImageUrl: data.profilePicture || "", // updated field name from your db
        });
        setImagePreview(data.profilePicture || "");
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error fetching profile:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to load profile data.");
    }
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = onAuthStateChanged(auth, (currentUser) => {
      if (!currentUser) {
        navigate("/login");
      } else {
        setUser(currentUser);
        fetchProfile(currentUser.uid);
      }
    });
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, [auth, fetchProfile, navigate]);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!user) return;

    const checkChanges = async () => {
      const dbData = await getUserProfile(user.uid);
      if (!dbData) {
        setHasChanges(true);
        return;
      }

      const fieldsToCompare = [
        "nickname",
        "fullName",
        "email",
        "phone",
        "year",
        "school",
        "group",
        "bio",
        "interests",
        "location",
      ];

      const changed = fieldsToCompare.some(
        (field) => (profileData[field] || "") !== (dbData[field] || "")
      );

      // Use profilePicture field from DB for comparison
      const imageChanged = profileData.profileImageUrl !== (dbData.profilePicture || "");

      setHasChanges(changed || imageChanged);
    };

    checkChanges();
  }, [profileData, user]);

  const handleChange = (e) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));
    setHasChanges(true);
  };

  const validateFile = (file) => {
    if (!file) return "No file selected.";
    if (!ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES.includes(file.type)) return "Invalid file type. Only JPG, PNG, GIF, WEBP allowed.";
    if (file.size > MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES) return "File too large. Max size is 2MB.";
    return null;
  };

  const handleImageChange = async (e) => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    const file = e.target.files[0];
    const error = validateFile(file);
    if (error) {
      setErrorMessage(error);
      e.target.value = null;
      return;
    }

    // Show local preview immediately
    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.onload = (ev) => setImagePreview(ev.target.result);
    reader.readAsDataURL(file);

    if (user && file) {
      try {
        // Upload to Storage AND update Firestore profile in one step
        const url = await saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB(user.uid, file);
        setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: url }));
        setHasChanges(true);
      } catch (uploadError) {
        console.error("Upload error:", uploadError);
        setErrorMessage("Failed to upload profile image.");
      }
    }
  };

  const handleRemoveImage = async () => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    setSuccessMessage("");
    if (!user) return;

    try {
      await deleteUserImage(user.uid);
      // Clear Firestore profilePicture field too
      await updateUserProfile(user.uid, { profilePicture: "" });

      setProfileData((prev) => ({ ...prev, profileImageUrl: "" }));
      setImagePreview("");
      setHasChanges(true);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Remove image error:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to remove profile image.");
    }
  };

  const validateProfile = () => {
    const requiredFields = ["fullName", "email", "phone", "year", "school", "group"];
    for (const field of requiredFields) {
      if (!profileData[field] || profileData[field].trim() === "") {
        setErrorMessage(`Please fill in the required field: ${field}`);
        return false;
      }
    }
    setErrorMessage("");
    return true;
  };

  const handleSave = async () => {
    if (!validateProfile()) return;
    if (!user) {
      setErrorMessage("No authenticated user.");
      return;
    }

    setIsSaving(true);
    setErrorMessage("");
    setSuccessMessage("");

    try {
      // Map profileImageUrl to profilePicture on save to keep consistent
      const dataToSave = {
        ...profileData,
        profilePicture: profileData.profileImageUrl,
      };
      delete dataToSave.profileImageUrl; // remove duplicate

      await updateUserProfile(user.uid, dataToSave);
      setSuccessMessage("Profile saved successfully!");
      setHasChanges(false);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Save error:", error);
      setErrorMessage("Failed to save profile. Please try again.");
    } finally {
      setIsSaving(false);
    }
  };

  const fallbackAvatar = "";

  const getInitials = () => {
    const sourceName = profileData.fullName || profileData.nickname || "U";
    const names = sourceName.trim().split(" ");
    if (names.length === 1) return names[0].charAt(0).toUpperCase();
    return names[0].charAt(0).toUpperCase() + names[1].charAt(0).toUpperCase();
  };

  const getRandomPastelColor = (seed) => {
    let hash = 0;
    for (let i = 0; i < seed.length; i++) {
      hash = seed.charCodeAt(i) + ((hash << 5) - hash);
    }
    const h = hash % 360;
    return `hsl(${h}, 70%, 80%)`;
  };

  const initialsBgColor = user ? getRandomPastelColor(user.uid) : "#cccccc";
  const displayImage = imagePreview || profileData.profileImageUrl || fallbackAvatar;

  return (
    <div className="profile-overview-container-wrapper">
      <div className="profile-overview-container" role="main" aria-label="User Profile Overview">
        <h2 className="profile-title">Profile Overview</h2>

        <div className="profile-images" style={{ justifyContent: "center", display: "flex", flexDirection: "column", alignItems: "center" }}>
          {displayImage ? (
            <img src={displayImage} alt="Profile avatar" className="profile-avatar" loading="lazy" />
          ) : (
            <div className="initials-avatar" aria-label="User initials avatar" style={{ backgroundColor: initialsBgColor }}>
              {getInitials()}
            </div>
          )}

          <input
            type="file"
            id="profile-upload"
            accept="image/*"
            onChange={handleImageChange}
            ref={fileInputRef}
            style={{ display: "none" }}
          />

          <div className="profile-image-actions" style={{ display: "flex", flexDirection: "column", alignItems: "center", gap: "0.5rem", marginTop: "0.5rem" }}>
            <label
              htmlFor="profile-upload"
              className="icon-button edit-button"
              tabIndex={0}
              aria-label="Upload new profile image"
            >
              &#9998;
            </label>

            {displayImage && displayImage !== fallbackAvatar && (
              <button
                type="button"
                onClick={handleRemoveImage}
                className="icon-button remove-button"
                aria-label="Remove profile image"
              >
                ×
              </button>
            )}
          </div>
        </div>

        {/* Form fields */}
        <div className="form-fields-container">
          {[
            { label: "Nickname", name: "nickname", type: "text" },
            { label: "Full Name*", name: "fullName", type: "text" },
            { label: "Email*", name: "email", type: "email" },
            { label: "Phone*", name: "phone", type: "tel" },
            { label: "Year*", name: "year", type: "text" },
            { label: "School*", name: "school", type: "text" },
            { label: "Group*", name: "group", type: "text" },
            { label: "Location", name: "location", type: "text" },
            { label: "Bio", name: "bio", type: "textarea" },
            { label: "Interests", name: "interests", type: "textarea" },
          ].map(({ label, name, type }) => (
            <div className="form-group" key={name}>
              <label className="form-label" htmlFor={name}>
                {label}
              </label>
              {type === "textarea" ? (
                <textarea
                  id={name}
                  name={name}
                  className="textarea-field"
                  value={profileData[name]}
                  onChange={handleChange}
                  rows={name === "bio" ? 4 : 3}
                />
              ) : (
                <input
                  id={name}
                  type={type}
                  name={name}
                  className="input-text"
                  value={profileData[name]}
                  onChange={handleChange}
                  aria-required={name !== "nickname"}
                  aria-invalid={errorMessage.includes(name) ? "true" : "false"}
                />
              )}
            </div>
          ))}
        </div>

        {/* Save button */}
        <div style={{ textAlign: "center", marginTop: "1.5rem" }}>
          <button
            onClick={handleSave}
            disabled={isSaving || !hasChanges}
            style={{
              backgroundColor: isSaving || !hasChanges ? "#a5b4fc" : "#2563eb",
              color: "white",
              padding: "0.6rem 1.2rem",
              border: "none",
              borderRadius: "6px",
              cursor: isSaving || !hasChanges ? "not-allowed" : "pointer",
              fontSize: "1rem",
              transition: "background-color 0.3s ease",
            }}
            aria-disabled={isSaving || !hasChanges}
          >
            {isSaving ? "Saving..." : "Save Changes"}
          </button>

          {errorMessage && (
            <p
              style={{ color: "red", marginTop: "0.8rem", fontSize: "0.9rem", fontWeight: "600" }}
              role="alert"
            >
              {errorMessage}
            </p>
          )}
          {successMessage && (
            <p
              style={{ color: "green", marginTop: "0.8rem", fontSize: "0.9rem", fontWeight: "600" }}
              role="status"
            >
              {successMessage}
            </p>
          )}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

Summary of key changes:

  • Profile image upload uses saveProfilePhotoAndUpdateDB(user.uid, file) from your storage service — this handles uploading and DB update atomically.

  • When removing the image, it deletes Storage object and clears the profilePicture field in Firestore.

  • Mapped Firestore's profilePicture field → component state profileImageUrl for UI consistency.

  • On save, converts profileImageUrl back to profilePicture for Firestore update.

  • Minor cleanup on error messages and comparison logic.

If you want me to help with tests, CSS tweaks, or integration with other parts, just say!

ChatGPT said:

Absolutely! Creating a dedicated ProfileImage subcomponent is a great idea to keep your code clean and modular, especially since image upload, preview, and removal logic is quite involved.

Here’s a step-by-step plan with a reusable ProfileImage component that you can import and use inside your ProfileOverview.jsx:

1. Create ProfileImage.jsx

jsx
// src/components/Profile/ProfileImage.jsx
import React, { useState, useRef } from "react";
import { uploadUserImage, deleteUserImage } from "../../services/storage";

const MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES = 2 * 1024 * 1024; // 2MB
const ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES = ["image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/gif", "image/webp"];

export default function ProfileImage({ userId, initialImageUrl, onImageChange, errorHandler }) {
  const [imagePreview, setImagePreview] = useState(initialImageUrl || "");
  const [errorMessage, setErrorMessage] = useState("");
  const fileInputRef = useRef(null);

  const validateFile = (file) => {
    if (!file) return "No file selected.";
    if (!ALLOWED_IMAGE_TYPES.includes(file.type)) return "Invalid file type. Only JPG, PNG, GIF, WEBP allowed.";
    if (file.size > MAX_IMAGE_SIZE_BYTES) return "File too large. Max size is 2MB.";
    return null;
  };

  const handleImageChange = async (e) => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    const file = e.target.files[0];
    const error = validateFile(file);
    if (error) {
      setErrorMessage(error);
      if (errorHandler) errorHandler(error);
      e.target.value = null;
      return;
    }

    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.onload = (ev) => setImagePreview(ev.target.result);
    reader.readAsDataURL(file);

    if (userId && file) {
      try {
        const url = await uploadUserImage(userId, file);
        setImagePreview(url);
        if (onImageChange) onImageChange(url);
      } catch (uploadError) {
        console.error("Upload error:", uploadError);
        const msg = "Failed to upload profile image.";
        setErrorMessage(msg);
        if (errorHandler) errorHandler(msg);
      }
    }
  };

  const handleRemoveImage = async () => {
    setErrorMessage("");
    if (!userId) return;

    try {
      await deleteUserImage(userId);
      setImagePreview("");
      if (onImageChange) onImageChange("");
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Remove image error:", error);
      const msg = "Failed to remove profile image.";
      setErrorMessage(msg);
      if (errorHandler) errorHandler(msg);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="profile-images">
      {imagePreview ? (
        <img src={imagePreview} alt="Profile avatar" className="profile-avatar" loading="lazy" />
      ) : (
        <div className="initials-avatar" aria-label="User initials avatar" />
      )}

      <input
        type="file"
        id="profile-upload"
        accept="image/*"
        onChange={handleImageChange}
        ref={fileInputRef}
        style={{ display: "none" }}
      />

      <div className="profile-image-actions">
        <label
          htmlFor="profile-upload"
          className="icon-button edit-button"
          tabIndex={0}
          aria-label="Upload new profile image"
        >
          &#9998;
        </label>

        {imagePreview && (
          <button
            type="button"
            onClick={handleRemoveImage}
            className="icon-button remove-button"
            aria-label="Remove profile image"
          >
            ×
          </button>
        )}
      </div>

      {errorMessage && (
        <p style={{ color: "red", marginTop: "0.5rem", fontSize: "0.9rem", fontWeight: "600" }} role="alert">
          {errorMessage}
        </p>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
